Instrument.name: Spatial Infrared Imaging TelescopeE
Instrument.description: The Spatial Infrared Imaging Telescope (SPIRIT) III instrument is the primary instrument on MSX covering the wavelength range from 2.5 to 28 micro-meter. It consists of an off-axis telescope with a 35-cm- diameter aperature, a six-channel Fourier-transform spectrometer, a five- band scanning radiometer, and a cryogenic Dewar/heat exchanger. Its objective is to demonstrate midcourse surveillance functions, to collect target and background phenomenology data, and to demonstrate advanced cryogenic sensor technologies in space. It will measure the spectral, spatial, and intensity parameters of stars, aurora, the Earth's airglow, and other upper atmospheric phenomena.
